data.text: To explain the meaning of: synonym: explain.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: The newspapers interpreted the ambassador's speech as an attempt at making peace.

data.text: To understand the significance of; construe.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: interpreted his smile to be an agreement; interpreted the open door as an invitation.

data.text: To present or conceptualize the meaning of by means of art or criticism.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: The actor interpreted the character with great subtlety.

data.text: To translate from one language into another.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: interpreted the ambassador's remarks for the assembly.

data.text: To serve as an interpreter for speakers of different languages.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To expound the meaning or significance of, as by translation or explanation; elucidate or unfold, as foreign or obscure language, a mystery, etc.; make plain or intelligible.
To show the purport of; develop or make clear by representation: as, to <internalXref urlencoded="interpret">interpret</internalXref> a drama or a character by action on the stage.
To construe; attribute a given meaning to: as, the company interpreted his silence unfavorably.
To practise interpretation; make an interpretation or explanation; tell or determine what something signifies.
